title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for f' on (0,4)

1 point is earned for showing f' has a max at t = 2 on (0,4)

1 point is earned if shows 12 < t < 16, f'(t) < f'(2)

1 point is earned for the answer

f is increasing on [0, 4] and on [12, 16].

On (12,16), f'( t )= 15−9 16−12 = 3 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaiaacE cadaqadaqaaiaadshaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqpdaWcaaqaaiaa igdacaaI1aGaeyOeI0IaaGyoaaqaaiaaigdacaaI2aGaeyOeI0IaaG ymaiaaikdaaaGaeyypa0ZaaSaaaeaacaaIZaaabaGaaGOmaaaaaaa@44BC@ since f has constant slope on this interval.

On (0,4), f'(t)=− 3 4 t 2 +3t MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaiaacE cacaGGOaGaamiDaiaacMcacqGH9aqpcqGHsisldaWcaaqaaiaaioda aeaacaaI0aaaaiaadshadaahaaWcbeqaaiaaikdaaaGccqGHRaWkca aIZaGaamiDaaaa@41E0@ and f ″ ( t ) = − 3 2 t + 3 = 0 when t = 2. This is where f' has a maximum on [0, 4] since f'' > 0 on (0,2) and f'' < 0 on (2, 4).

On [0, 24], f is increasing at its greatest rate when t = 2 because f'(2)=3> 3 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaiaacE cacaGGOaGaaGOmaiaacMcacqGH9aqpcaaIZaGaeyOpa4ZaaSaaaeaa caaIZaaabaGaaGOmaaaaaaa@3DF5@ .
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for f' on (0,4)

1 point is earned for showing f' has a max at t = 2 on (0,4)

1 point is earned if shows 12 < t < 16, f'(t) < f'(2)

1 point is earned for the answer

f is increasing on [0, 4] and on [12, 16].

On (12,16), f'( t )= 15−9 16−12 = 3 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaiaacE cadaqadaqaaiaadshaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqpdaWcaaqaaiaa igdacaaI1aGaeyOeI0IaaGyoaaqaaiaaigdacaaI2aGaeyOeI0IaaG ymaiaaikdaaaGaeyypa0ZaaSaaaeaacaaIZaaabaGaaGOmaaaaaaa@44BC@ since f has constant slope on this interval.

On (0,4), f'(t)=− 3 4 t 2 +3t MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaiaacE cacaGGOaGaamiDaiaacMcacqGH9aqpcqGHsisldaWcaaqaaiaaioda aeaacaaI0aaaaiaadshadaahaaWcbeqaaiaaikdaaaGccqGHRaWkca aIZaGaamiDaaaa@41E0@ and f ″ ( t ) = − 3 2 t + 3 = 0 when t = 2. This is where f' has a maximum on [0, 4] since f'' > 0 on (0,2) and f'' < 0 on (2, 4).
